alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Doddridge; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:13AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Doddridge, southwestern Taylor, Lewis, northern Upshur, western Barbour and Harrison Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 711 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line thunderstorms from Salem to near Sand Run, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Buckhannon, Weston, Philippi, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Lumberport, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, Enterprise, West Milford, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flemington, and Grangeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 87 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 63 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
